questions.question: Translate: 'Штани' - _______.
Choose the correct option: 'I like _____ dress. It's very elegant.'
Complete the sentence: '______ shoes are too big for me.'
Fill in the blanks with the correct interrogative pronoun: '______ is your favorite color?'
Use the correct demonstrative pronoun: 'I don't like this shirt. I prefer ______ one over there.'
What is the plural form of 'hat'?
Write a sentence using the present simple tense with the verb 'to wear.'
answers: I wear a hat every day.
I am wearing a hat now.
I will wear a hat tomorrow.
I have worn a hat before.
questions.correctAnswer: I wear a hat every day.

questions.question: Choose the correct option: '______ jacket is this? It's so stylish!'
Translate: 'Фрукти' - _______.
Use the correct indefinite pronoun: 'I don't have ______ apples. Can I have some of yours?'
Fill in the blank: 'There is ______ sugar in my coffee.'
Choose the correct option: 'I have ______ friends in this city.'
Write a sentence using the word 'lots of.'
answers: I don't have lots of time.

questions.question: What is the difference between 'some' and 'any'?
answers: 'Some' is used in positive statements, and 'any' is used in negative and interrogative statements.
'Some' is used in negative and interrogative statements, and 'any' is used in positive statements.
'Some' is used only in positive statements, and 'any' is used only in negative statements.
'Some' and 'any' can be used interchangeably in any sentence.
questions.correctAnswer: 'Some' is used in positive statements, and 'any' is used in negative and interrogative statements.

questions.question: Use the correct pronoun: 'She likes pizza, but she doesn't like _______ with mushrooms.'
Translate: 'Модальне дієслово 'must' - _______.'
Write a sentence in the past simple tense about your last vacation.
answers: I will visit Paris next summer.

questions.question: Choose the correct option: '______ you ever been to London?'
Use the modal verb 'should' in a sentence.
What are the modal verbs used for?
answers: Expressing possibility, necessity, ability, and permission.
questions.correctAnswer: Expressing possibility, necessity, ability, and permission.

questions.question: Use the modal verb 'mustn’t' in a sentence.
answers: You mustn’t smoke in this area.
You must smoke in this area.
questions.correctAnswer: You mustn’t smoke in this area.

questions.question: Write a sentence using the modal verb 'may.'
Choose the correct option: 'She ______ go to the dentist yesterday.'
Translate: 'Прийменники місця 'in/at' - _______.'
Write a sentence using the preposition 'at.'
Choose the correct option: 'We visited the museum ______ Saturday.'
Use the adverb of time 'yesterday' in a sentence.
What is the meaning of the adverb 'ago'?
Write a sentence using the adverb 'last.'
answers: I will see you last Monday.
I am seeing you last Monday.

questions.question: Choose the correct option: 'The school is ______ the park.'
Fill in the blank: 'I have lived here ______ three years.'
Translate: 'Present Perfect + yet/already' - _______.
Write a sentence using 'already.'
answers: I am already doing my homework.
I will already do my homework.

questions.question: Choose the correct option: 'We ______ seen that movie.'
Use the word 'yet' in a sentence.
What does 'already' indicate in a sentence?
answers: Something happened before the expected time.
Something will happen in the future.
questions.correctAnswer: Something happened before the expected time.

questions.question: Write a sentence using the word 'recently.'
answers: I will recently visit my grandparents.
I am recently visiting my grandparents.

questions.question: Choose the correct option: 'I haven't met her ______.'
Fill in the blank: 'They ______ finished the project.'
Translate: 'Порівняння Past Simple та Present Perfect' - _______.
questions.correctAnswer: Порівняння Past Simple та Present Perfect

questions.question: Write a sentence using the past simple tense.
answers: I am finishing my book yesterday.
I will finish my book yesterday.

questions.question: Choose the correct option: 'He ______ already ______ his lunch when I called.'
Use the word 'before' in a sentence.
answers: I finish my homework before dinner.
I am finishing my homework before dinner.
I will finish my homework before dinner.
I finished my homework before dinner.
questions.correctAnswer: I finish my homework before dinner.

questions.question: What is the main difference between Past Simple and Present Perfect?
answers: Past Simple is used for completed actions in the past, and Present Perfect is used for actions that happened at an unspecified time before now.
Present Perfect is used for completed actions in the past, and Past Simple is used for actions that happened at an unspecified time before now.
Past Simple is used only for actions that happened today.
Present Perfect is used only for actions that happened today.
questions.correctAnswer: Past Simple is used for completed actions in the past, and Present Perfect is used for actions that happened at an unspecified time before now.

questions.question: Write a sentence using the word 'already.'
answers: I am already doing my homework.
I will already do my homework.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'He ______ lived here since 2010.'
